column6: PECIA was registered with SEC  on April 29, 2013 with Reg.#CN201308298. E-Cigarette current issues, news, facts & studies in Philippines and Worldwide.
column31: "Joey Dulay, president of PECIA, said certain provisions of the guidelines “are almost impossible to comply with.” He added that “small players will be driven out of business and new players will find it extremely difficult to enter the sector.”
column35: FDA receiving foreign money ‘shameful and scandalous’ - vaping groups - Manila Bulletin
column36: Vaping experts scored the Food and Drugs Administration (FDA) for receiving foreign grants from American business interest groups to virtually impose a ban on e-cigarettes and heated tobacco products in the country describing it as a “shameful and scandalous” act.

column31: “This is shameful and scandalous. A Philippine regulatory body receiving money from American businessmen to draft a set of regulation they cannot even get passed in their own country." - Dr. Lorenzo Mata Jr., president of Quit For Good Mga brothers, tumanggap ng grants ang FDA galing sa American business interest groups na ang epekto ay halos i-ban na ang e-cigarettes and heated tobacco products dito sa bansa natin. Napaka-unfair nito sa mga consumers at iba pang stakeholders! #VaperAko
